isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - WATER PUMP AND THERMOSTAT - THERMOSTAT - INSPECTION AND REPAIR

step1.para:
Visually inspect the thermostat seal, located in the thermostat housing, for lip damage. Refer to Figure 10.27
for seal location.

note.para: The seal should be replaced each time the thermostat is replaced.

step1.para: Replace the seal, if required, as follows:

step2.para: Pry the damaged seal from the housing using a suitable pry bar.
Install a new seal into the housing using a suitable disc, drift and hammer.

Install the seal flush as shown in Figure 10.28
.

step1.para: Visually inspect the thermostat for the following conditions, which may cause improper closure: Replace as required. (Refer to Figure 10.29).

step2.para: Debris or loose fit at seat.
Wrong seal location (look for witness mark).
Wrong seal location (look for witness mark).

step1.para:
Check thermostat operation as follows: (Refer to Figure 10.30
).

caution.para: EXERCISE CAUTION AND GOOD JUDGEMENT TO AVOID INJURY WHEN DEALING WITH HOT WATER AND OBJECTS DURING THE THERMOSTAT OPERATION CHECK. USE HEAT RESISTANT GLOVES AND WEAR APPROPRIATE EYE PROTECTION.

step1.para: Manually open the thermostat enough to insert a nylon ribbon under the thermostat seat. Suspend the thermostat in the container so that the thermostat does not touch the bottom of the container.

2. Heat the container filled with water to the "Start-to-Open" temperature of 82° C (180° F). Observe the thermometer and record the temperature as soon as the thermostat drops from the nylon ribbon. THIS READING IS THE "START-TO-OPEN" TEMPERATURE.

Continue to heat water to the "Full- Open" temperature of 94° C (202° F). Observe the thermometer and movement of thermostat sleeve. Observe the thermostat sleeve movement when "Full-Open" temperature is achieved. Minimum sleeve travel at "Full-Open" temperature is 50 mm (1.97 in.) Refer to Figure 10.29
.
Remove the thermostat from the water and while the sleeve is off of the seat, inspect the seat area for pitting and foreign deposits.
Replace the thermostat if it does not operate as described above.
